roleset.name: to supply with power
roleset.note: POWER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'power' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from power.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: passive
example.text: The announcements are scheduled [*-3] to be made [*-1]in Temple , Texas , and include a so-called `` notebook '' PC that [*T*-2]-4 weighs less than seven pounds , has a built-in hard disk drive and is powered [*-4] by Intel Corp. 's 286 microprocessor .

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: Stewart& Stevenson makes equipment-1 powered [*]-1 with diesel and gas turbines .

example.name: transitive
example.text: The company 's lean operation , analysts said [0] [*T*-1], allowed sharp-rising sales from its cholesterol drug , Lopid , to power earnings growth .
example.arg: sharp-rising sales from its cholesterol drug , Lopid ,

roleset.name: having great power, influence
roleset.note: POWERFUL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6. (from powerful.01-j)

role.descr: what the power is used for-- secondary action

example.name: arg1-emotional power
example.text: " Treating the soft environment as cherishing our life , " the statement by this party secretary is so powerful ,
example.arg: [the statement by this party secretary] *link-> [" Treating the soft environment as cherishing our life , "]

example.name: both args
example.text: God's Word is Powerful to Accomplish all His Purposes.

example.name: concatenation of arg1
example.text: The video they created simulating an active shooter in a school is powerful to watch.
example.arg: [The video they created simulating an active shooter in a school] [to watch]
